info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 3:56AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Heavy snow band will impact portions of Sierra, Nevada, northern Churchill, Storey, southern Washoe, Pershing and north central Lyon Counties through 515 AM PST... At 352 AM PST, Doppler radar and observations was tracking a heavy snow band along a line extending from near Imlay to near Virginia Peak to Verdi. This will impact Interstate 80. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy snow will create periods of very low visibility. SOURCE...Radar indicated and ground observations. IMPACT...Very dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could also knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reno, Lovelock, Sparks, Fernley, Wingfield Springs, Northwest Reno, Spanish Springs, Golden Valley, Virginia Peak, Verdi-Mogul, Oreana, Hidden Valley, Somersett, Verdi, Derby Dam, Lemmon Valley, Trinity Junction, Lockwood, Cold Springs Valley and Lemmon Valley-Golden Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Consider post-poning travel until conditions improve.
